newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sumitomo says some copper positions remain.
newsitem.headline: Sumitomo says some copper positions remain.

text.p: Sumitomo Corp still retains some copper positions related to massive trading losses announced earlier this year, but it does not expect any further upward revisions to its estimated losses, executive vice president Takehiko Yonezu said on Tuesday.
Asked if all of the positions related to the losses had been liquidated, Yonezu told a news conference: "There are still some left."
He added, however, the company expected no revisions to its estimate of $2.6 billion in losses from alleged unauthorised trading by its former chief copper trader Yasuo Hamanaka.

Yonezu reiterated comments by Sumitomo officials on September 19, when the trade house raised its estimate of copper trading losses to $2.6 billion from an estimated $1.8 billion announced on June 13.
Prior to the news conference, Sumitomo reported a net consolidated loss of 212.12 billion yen in the April-September interim period, reflecting the impact of its copper trading losses.
